File libsrc/libgrtd/RTDError.c

Routines for handling libgrtd error messages.

RTDSetErrorMsg is used mainly inside libgRTD to store messages in a static location that will be returned by RTDErrMsg.

RTDErrMsg is used after calls to libgRTD routines to retrieve the most recent error message.

The following errors can be generated by libRTD: 

      Error-Code                         Error
  RTD_BAD_PATH        RTDataOpen cannot open the CD receiver directory.
  RTD_NULL_PATH       The path argument to RTDataOpen is NULL.
  RTD_BAD_STATION     Invalid station name input to RTDataAddChannel.
  RTD_BAD_CHANNEL     Invalid channel name input to RTDataAddChannel.
  RTD_OPEN_DIR_ERR    Cannot open a database directory.
  RTD_STAT_FILE_ERR   Cannot stat a file in the database.
  RTD_OPENR_FILE_ERR  Cannot open a file for reading.
  RTD_OPENW_FILE_ERR  Cannot open a file for writing.
  RTD_RTDreadCD_ERR   The default author directory does not exist.
  RTD_RTDseek_ERR     Error seeking in a file.
  RTD_REACQUIRE_ERR   CD reacquire error.
  RTD_NO_TIME         Cannot determine the time for a table creation.
  RTD_IMPORT_ERR      Cannot open an import file or directory.
  RTD_PTHREAD_ERR     A call to pthread_create failed.
  RTD_SEM_INIT_ERR    A call to sem_init failed.
  RTD_SEM_POST_ERR    A call to sem_post failed.
  RTD_JOIN_ERR        A call to pthread_join failed.
  RTD_MALLOC_ERR      A call to malloc failed.

Public Function Index

RTDErrMsg ()
Get a libRTD error message.
RTDErrno ()
Get a libRTD error number.

Public Functions

RTDErrMsg 
 char *RTDErrMsg()
Get a libRTD error message.

Returns:
the most recent libRTD error message.
RTDErrno 
 int RTDErrno()
Get a libRTD error number.

Returns:
the most recent RTD error number.
